channel.title: Biotech on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Biotech on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: Crispr Offers New Hope for Treating Diabetes
item.description: Gene-edited pancreatic cells have been transplanted into a patient with type 1 diabetes for the first time. They produced insulin for months without the patient needing to take immunosuppressants.

item.title: Crispr Offers New Hope for Treating Diabetes
item.description: Gene-edited pancreatic cells have been transplanted into a patient with type 1 diabetes for the first time. They produced insulin for months without the patient needing to take immunosuppressants.

item.title: Researchers Create 3D-Printed Artificial Skin That Allows Blood Circulation
item.description: Swedish researchers have developed two types of 3D bioprinting technology to artificially generate skin containing blood vessels. It could be a breakthrough in the quest to regenerate damaged skin.

item.title: Researchers Create 3D-Printed Artificial Skin That Allows Blood Circulation
item.description: Swedish researchers have developed two types of 3D bioprinting technology to artificially generate skin containing blood vessels. It could be a breakthrough in the quest to regenerate damaged skin.

item.title: Neuralink’s Bid to Trademark ‘Telepathy’ and ‘Telekinesis’ Faces Legal Issues
item.description: The brain implant company cofounded by Elon Musk filed to trademark the product names Telepathy and Telekinesis. But it turns out that another person had already filed to trademark those names.

item.title: Neuralink’s Bid to Trademark ‘Telepathy’ and ‘Telekinesis’ Faces Legal Issues
item.description: The brain implant company cofounded by Elon Musk filed to trademark the product names Telepathy and Telekinesis. But it turns out that another person had already filed to trademark those names.

item.title: China Is Building a Brain-Computer Interface Industry
item.description: A new policy document outlines China’s plan to create an internationally competitive BCI industry within five years, and proposes developing devices for both health and consumer uses.

item.title: China Is Building a Brain-Computer Interface Industry
item.description: A new policy document outlines China’s plan to create an internationally competitive BCI industry within five years, and proposes developing devices for both health and consumer uses.

item.title: RFK Jr. Is Supporting mRNA Research—Just Not for Vaccines
item.description: HHS is slashing hundreds of millions in funding for mRNA vaccines and infectious disease treatments, but leaving the door open to mRNA therapies for cancer and genetic conditions.

item.title: RFK Jr. Is Supporting mRNA Research—Just Not for Vaccines
item.description: HHS is slashing hundreds of millions in funding for mRNA vaccines and infectious disease treatments, but leaving the door open to mRNA therapies for cancer and genetic conditions.

item.title: Where Are All the AI Drugs?
item.description: In an industry where 90 percent of drug candidates fail before reaching the market, a handful of startups are betting everything on AI to beat the odds.
